org.bytedeco.arrow

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.arrow.FileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocalFileSystem, MockFileSystem, SlowFileSystem, SubTreeFileSystem

    @Namespace(value="arrow::fs")
 @NoOffset
 @Properties(inherit=arrow.class)
public class FileSystem
extends Pointer
    \brief Abstract file system API

public String type_name()

 @ByRef

      • NormalizePath

        @ByVal
public StringResult NormalizePath(@StdString
                                         String path)
        Normalize path for the given filesystem The default implementation of this method is a no-op, but subclasses may allow normalizing irregular path forms (such as Windows local paths).

      • NormalizePath

        @ByVal
public StringResult NormalizePath(@StdString
                                         BytePointer path)

      • Equals

        @Cast(value="bool")
public boolean Equals(@Const @ByRef
                                          FileSystem other)

      • GetFileInfo

        @ByVal
public FileInfoResult GetFileInfo(@StdString
                                         String path)
        Get info for the given target. Any symlink is automatically dereferenced, recursively. A nonexistent or unreachable file returns an Ok status and has a FileType of value NotFound. An error status indicates a truly exceptional condition (low-level I/O error, etc.).

      • GetFileInfo

        @ByVal
public FileInfoResult GetFileInfo(@StdString
                                         BytePointer path)

      • GetFileInfo

        @ByVal
public FileInfoVectorResult GetFileInfo(@Const @ByRef
                                               StringVector paths)
        Same, for many targets at once.

      • GetFileInfo

        @ByVal
public FileInfoVectorResult GetFileInfo(@Const @ByRef
                                               FileSelector select)
        Same, according to a selector. The selector's base directory will not be part of the results, even if it exists. If it doesn't exist, see FileSelector::allow_not_found.

      • GetFileInfoAsync

        @ByVal
public FileInfoVectorFuture GetFileInfoAsync(@Const @ByRef
                                                    StringVector paths)
        EXPERIMENTAL: async version of GetFileInfo

      • GetFileInfoGenerator

        @ByVal
 @Cast(value="arrow::fs::FileInfoGenerator*")
public Pointer GetFileInfoGenerator(@Const @ByRef
                                                                                         FileSelector select)
        EXPERIMENTAL: streaming async version of GetFileInfo The returned generator is not async-reentrant, i.e. you need to wait for the returned future to complete before calling the generator again.

      • CreateDir

        @ByVal
public Status CreateDir(@StdString
                               String path,
                               @Cast(value="bool")
                               boolean recursive)
        Create a directory and subdirectories. This function succeeds if the directory already exists.

        @ByVal
public Status DeleteDir(@StdString
                               BytePointer path)

      • DeleteDirContents

        @ByVal
public Status DeleteDirContents(@StdString
                                       String path)
        Delete a directory's contents, recursively. Like DeleteDir, but doesn't delete the directory itself. Passing an empty path ("" or "/") is disallowed, see DeleteRootDirContents.

      • DeleteDirContents

        @ByVal
public Status DeleteDirContents(@StdString
                                       BytePointer path)

      • DeleteRootDirContents

        @ByVal
public Status DeleteRootDirContents()
        EXPERIMENTAL: Delete the root directory's contents, recursively. Implementations may decide to raise an error if this operation is too dangerous.

      • DeleteFile

        @ByVal
public Status DeleteFile(@StdString
                                String path)
        Delete a file.

      • DeleteFile

        @ByVal
public Status DeleteFile(@StdString
                                BytePointer path)

      • DeleteFiles

        @ByVal
public Status DeleteFiles(@Const @ByRef
                                 StringVector paths)
        Delete many files. The default implementation issues individual delete operations in sequence.

      • Move

        @ByVal
public Status Move(@StdString
                          String src,
                          @StdString
                          String dest)
        Move / rename a file or directory. If the destination exists: - if it is a non-empty directory, an error is returned - otherwise, if it has the same type as the source, it is replaced - otherwise, behavior is unspecified (implementation-dependent).

      • Move

        @ByVal
public Status Move(@StdString
                          BytePointer src,
                          @StdString
                          BytePointer dest)

      • CopyFile

        @ByVal
public Status CopyFile(@StdString
                              String src,
                              @StdString
                              String dest)
        Copy a file. If the destination exists and is a directory, an error is returned. Otherwise, it is replaced.

      • CopyFile

        @ByVal
public Status CopyFile(@StdString
                              BytePointer src,

                              BytePointer dest)

                                                BytePointer path)

      • OpenInputStream

        @ByVal
public InputStreamResult OpenInputStream(@Const @ByRef
                                                FileInfo info)
        Open an input stream for sequential reading. This override assumes the given FileInfo validly represents the file's characteristics, and may optimize access depending on them (for example avoid querying the file size or its existence).

      • OpenInputFile

        @ByVal
public RandomAccessFileResult OpenInputFile(@StdString
                                                   String path)
        Open an input file for random access reading.

public RandomAccessFileResult OpenInputFile(@Const @ByRef
                                                   FileInfo info)
        Open an input file for random access reading. This override assumes the given FileInfo validly represents the file's characteristics, and may optimize access depending on them (for example avoid querying the file size or its existence).

      • OpenOutputStream

        @ByVal
public OutputStreamResult OpenOutputStream(@StdString
                                                  String path)
        Open an output stream for sequential writing. If the target already exists, existing data is truncated.

      • OpenOutputStream

        @ByVal
public OutputStreamResult OpenOutputStream(@StdString
                                                  BytePointer path)

      • OpenAppendStream

        @ByVal
public OutputStreamResult OpenAppendStream(@StdString
                                                  String path)
        Open an output stream for appending. If the target doesn't exist, a new empty file is created.

      • OpenAppendStream

        @ByVal
public OutputStreamResult OpenAppendStream(@StdString
                                                  BytePointer path)
